title: Primary Three Thematic Curriculum Syllabus
description: The P3 Thematic Curriculum continues the thematic approach from P2 with 12 themes focusing on expanding knowledge, skills and competences. It serves as a bridge between lower primary thematic learning and upper primary subject-based learning, preparing children for P4 subject-based curriculum.

themes.name: Our Sub-county/Division
themes.description: Understanding the wider geographical and administrative community

themes.name: Livelihood in Our Sub-county/Division
themes.description: Exploring various economic activities and occupations

themes.name: Environment and Weather
themes.description: Learning about weather patterns, climate and natural phenomena

themes.name: Living Things: Animals
themes.description: Studying animal diversity, habitats and behaviors

themes.name: Living Things: Plants
themes.description: Understanding plant characteristics, growth and uses

themes.name: Water and Natural Resources
themes.description: Appreciating water and other natural resources and conservation

themes.name: Cultural Heritage
themes.description: Exploring local culture, traditions and history

themes.name: Peace, Rights and Responsibilities
themes.description: Understanding human rights, responsibilities and conflict resolution

themes.name: Energy and Movement
themes.description: Learning about forces, motion and energy in practical contexts

themes.name: Communication and Technology
themes.description: Understanding communication systems and basic technology

themes.name: Trade and Commerce
themes.description: Learning about economic activities, business and entrepreneurship

assessment_approach: Competence-based assessment with increasing focus on subject-specific skills
transition_to_upper_primary: P3 prepares children for subject-based learning in P4-P7
teaching_methodology: Child-centered with increasing emphasis on critical thinking and problem-solving
special_features: Bridge between thematic (P1-P3) and subject-based (P4-P7) curriculum
Integration of practical skills and life competences
